Summary 13 years of Top Performing outside Sales experience. Includes 10 years of Medical Device sales with Covidien earning Rep of the Year Award and multiple President’s Clubs and Award trips. 
 
Proven Leadership skills demonstrated in Division I College Athletics (Football- University of Oregon Ducks) and in multiple corporate roles. 
 
Well-rounded business background with MBA from Top 25 ranked Business School (University of Southern California- USC) and additional professional experience in Product Marketing and Operations/Supply Chain Management. Proven Leadership skills demonstrated in Division I College Athletics (Football- University of Oregon Ducks) and in multiple corporate roles. 
 
Well-rounded business background with MBA from Top 25 ranked Business School (University of Southern California- USC) and additional professional experience in Product Marketing and Operations/Supply Chain Management. Experience Senior Territory Manager Covidien- Interventional Oncology December 2007  – Present (7 years 9 months) Phoenix, Arizona Area Represent the Interventional Oncology Division of $10 billion medical products company by selling highly complex Microwave and Radiofrequency Ablation Devices used in the treatment of Liver, Lung and Kidney Cancer. Called on Physicians in Interventional Radiology and OR including Interventional Radiologists, Transplant Surgeons, Surgical Oncologists, Hepatobiliary Surgeons, and General Surgeons. 
 
Exceeded quota year-in-year-out with long track record of success while earning multiple sales awards including Golden Eagle Award in 2010 and Pace Setters Award in 2012. 
 
Promoted to Senior Rep in 2011 after demonstrating years of consistent sales performance and leadership amongst peers. 
 
Built territory from the ground up and grew sales by 10X in less than 3 years as the divisions first locally based rep in Arizona (essentially a “start-up” within a large corporation).  
 
Sold the first ever Microwave Ablation System in the Southwestern US (by any company) to Mayo Clinic in Arizona. Closed capital equipment deal by gaining clinical champions with several KOL Mayo Physicians and strongly influenced the local markets evolution form RF Ablation to Microwave Ablation. 
 
Expanded sales by earning new business in prominent hospitals including Mayo Clinic, Scottsdale Healthcare, Banner Health, University Medical Center Tucson, Carondelet Tucson, and CTCA. Account Manager Covidien- SharpSafety Division April 2004  –  December 2007  (3 years 9 months) Phoenix, Arizona Area Earned Rep of the Year honors by finishing 2006 as the #1 Rep (of 72) in the division. Grew Arizona Territory by $1.2 Million in sales in 1 year (figure represented 66% of Southwest Region’s total growth and 26% of entire West Zone’s growth). 
 
Recognized as member of “Circle of Excellence” Club in 2006 (Top 100 Reps of 5000+ worldwide- Highest Sales award at Covidien). Also named President of Curity Club and Regional Impact Salesperson of the Year. 
 
Achieved President’s Club (Kendall Curity Club) in back-to-back years in 2006 and 2007. 
 
Trained new reps as Field Sales Trainer and Kendall Associate Corporate Trainer. 
 
Call on and sell to key clinicians in all departments of a hospital including OR, Anesthesia, Cath Lab, Radiology, Endoscopy, ICU, ER, Med/Surg, Infection Control and Materials Management. 
 
Won Master’s Award for finishing as the #1 Rep in Advanced Corporate Training Class. Senior Commodity Manager Intel Corporation June 2001  –  September 2003  (2 years 4 months) Chandler, AZ Post MBA operations/supply chain position managing Intel’s business relationships with key capital equipment suppliers including annual capital expenditures of $30-$40 million. Provided sourcing support to Intel manufacturing facilities worldwide.  
 
Managed all business aspects of multi-million dollar capital equipment supplier selections including RFP process, contract and price negotiations, comprehensive supplier evaluations and final supplier selection. 
 
Presented “State of the Business” to supplier CEO and VP’s at quarterly Executive Review Meetings. Account Consultant NCR Corporation July 1996  –  July 1999  (3 years 1 month) Las Vegas, Nevada Area Managed Nevada sales territory as NCR’s only rep in the state. Grew sales and market share and built strong relationships in intensely competitive B2B market with result of nearly 3X territory sales growth in 3-year period.  
 
Named to NCR President’s Club (CPC) and awarded with trip to Hawaii in 1st year of eligibility. Ranked #6 (of 50) in West Region. 
 
Closed new business deal with Citibank creating the first major account in Nevada and one of the division’s Top 10 accounts nationwide. 
 
Won multiple Top Salesperson of the Month honors and received 2 sales level promotions. Senior Territory Manager Covidien- Interventional Oncology December 2007  – Present (7 years 9 months) Phoenix, Arizona Area Represent the Interventional Oncology Division of $10 billion medical products company by selling highly complex Microwave and Radiofrequency Ablation Devices used in the treatment of Liver, Lung and Kidney Cancer. Summary I'm a Strategic Sourcing/Commodity/Supplier Manager with over Twenty years of extremely diversified experience. My career has had an emphasis on Negotiation, Supplier Management, Procurement, Mechanical and Manufacturing engineering. I'm skilled in cost reduction, TCO, LEAN, supplier relations, and new product introduction (NPI).  
I have worked in Low and Hi-Tech industries with Mechanical, Electrical and Electronic components and assemblies, in both low volume-high mix and extremely high volumes. 
I have managed suppliers from sole proprietors to large multi-national corporations with great success and mutual benefit to both buyer and supplier.
